  • Constructor Details

      public CollectionUtils()

  • Method Details

    • addIfAbsent

      public static <T> boolean addIfAbsent(Collection<T> collection, T item)
      Adds the given element to the list only if it is not already present.

      Presence is determined using List.contains(Object), which relies on the Object.equals(Object) contract of the element type.

      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to modify
      item - the element to add if supported by the list)
      Returns:
      true if the element was not already contained in the list and was added; false otherwise

    • addIfAbsentByIdentity

      public static <T> boolean addIfAbsentByIdentity(Collection<T> collection, T item)
      Adds the given element to the list only if no identical (==) element is already present.

      Identity comparison (==) is used instead of Object.equals(Object).

      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to modify
      item - the element to add
      Returns:
      true if the list did not already contain the given element by identity and it was added; false otherwise

    • removeLast

      public static <T> T removeLast(List<T> list)
      Removes the last item in this list.
      Returns:
      the item previously at the specified position
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the list is empty
      UnsupportedOperationException - if the remove operation is not supported by this list

    • removeLastNullable

      public static <T> @Nullable T removeLastNullable(@Nullable List<T> list)
      Removes the last item in this list.
      Returns:
      the item previously at the specified position or null if the list is empty
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if the remove operation is not supported by this list

    • reverse

      public static <T> List<T> reverse(List<T> list)

    • setAt

      public static <T> T setAt(List<T> list, int index, T item)
      Sets the item at the specified index in the list.

      Supports negative indices (-1 = last item, -2 = second-last, etc.).

      Returns:
      the previous item at the index
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range

    • setAtEnsuringSize

      public static <@Nullable T> T setAtEnsuringSize(List<@Nullable T> list, int index, @Nullable T item)
      Sets the item at the specified index in the list, growing the list with null items if required.

      Supports negative indices (-1 = last item, -2 = second-last, etc.).

      Returns:
      the previous item at the index, or null if the list was extended
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if computed index is negative

    • tail

      Parameters:
      n - last n items to return
      Returns:
      a new list with the last n items of the input list
